title: Floods and Storms Hurt Animals
summary: This winter, big floods and storms have hurt many animals. The water has destroyed nests where birds lay eggs and drowned small animals like hedgehogs and field voles. Experts say this might mean fewer butterflies and insects in spring because their eggs and babies got washed away. Seabirds like puffins have been found on beaches, and turtles have been stranded, some alive and some dead. Animals that move slowly, such as hedgehogs, are in danger because they cannot escape the rising water quickly. Rescue groups are worried because winters are getting wetter, making it hard for animals to survive. They say animals need help to find safe places during storms.

background_read: Floods happen when too much rain falls, and storms are big weather events with wind and rain. Animals like birds, hedgehogs, and butterflies live in nature and need safe homes. When floods come, their homes can be destroyed, and they might not survive. This article talks about how bad weather this winter has hurt wildlife, and experts are trying to help them.
